ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: The event name for which the data was collected
In the past two weeks, how often has your child put off or avoided doing things that were hard for him or her because they required a lot of attention?
Notes: 0=Not at all; 1=Rarely; 2=Several days; 3=More than half the days; 4=Nearly every day

ElementDescription: Do the problems we have just been talking about cause difficulties for your child in any of the following areas:With family
Do the problems we have just been talking about cause difficulties for your child in any of the following areas:With friends
In the past two weeks, how often has your child talked when he or she wasn't supposed to, or had people complain that he or she talked too much?
Notes: 0=Not at all; 1=Rarely; 2=Several days; 3=More than half the days; 4=Nearly every day

ElementDescription: In the past two weeks, how often has your child interrupted someone when they were talking?
Notes: 0=Not at all; 1=Rarely; 2=Several days; 3=More than half the days; 4=Nearly every day

ElementDescription: In the past two weeks, how often has your child had trouble waiting for his or her turn or waiting for other things?
Notes: 0=Not at all; 1=Rarely; 2=Several days; 3=More than half the days; 4=Nearly every day

ElementDescription: In the past two weeks, how often has your child blurt out answers in school without being called on, or blurt out answers when someone wasn't talking to him or her?
Notes: 0=Not at all; 1=Rarely; 2=Several days; 3=More than half the days; 4=Nearly every day

ElementDescription: In the past two weeks, how often has your child had trouble being quiet when he or she was supposed to be quiet?
Notes: 0=Not at all; 1=Rarely; 2=Several days; 3=More than half the days; 4=Nearly every day

ElementDescription: In the past two weeks, how often has your child been on the go, moving from one place to another?
Notes: 0=Not at all; 1=Rarely; 2=Several days; 3=More than half the days; 4=Nearly every day

ElementDescription: In the past two weeks, how often has your child run or climbed on things when he or she was not supposed to?
Notes: 0=Not at all; 1=Rarely; 2=Several days; 3=More than half the days; 4=Nearly every day

ElementDescription: In the past two weeks, how often has your child felt fidgety, like it was hard to sit without bouncing his or her leg or getting up and moving around?
Notes: 0=Not at all; 1=Rarely; 2=Several days; 3=More than half the days; 4=Nearly every day

ElementDescription: In the past two weeks, how often has your child forgotten something somewhere or forgotten to do something he or she was supposed to do?
Notes: 0=Not at all; 1=Rarely; 2=Several days; 3=More than half the days; 4=Nearly every day

ElementDescription: In the past two weeks, how often has your child lost his or her homework, pencils, jacket, cell phone, or anything else big or small?
Notes: 0=Not at all; 1=Rarely; 2=Several days; 3=More than half the days; 4=Nearly every day

ElementDescription: Do the problems we have just been talking about cause difficulties for your child in any of the following areas:At school
In the past two weeks, how often has your child had trouble organizing his or her homework or other tasks?
Notes: 0=Not at all; 1=Rarely; 2=Several days; 3=More than half the days; 4=Nearly every day

ElementDescription: In the past two weeks, how often has your child not followed instructions that a parent or teacher said to him or her, or instructions on an assignment or test?
Notes: 0=Not at all; 1=Rarely; 2=Several days; 3=More than half the days; 4=Nearly every day

ElementDescription: In the past 2 weeks, how often has your child forgotten or tuned out what you or their teachers said to him or her?
Notes: 0=Not at all; 1=Rarely; 2=Several days; 3=More than half the days; 4=Nearly every day
